# Literal interface

> This API is provided as a beta preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.
> 

An immediately defined value.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export interface Literal 
```

## Remarks

Always contains a string value. In Function arguments and options, the expeted type of the value may result in the value being further parsed as a boolean or a number.

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [\[cst\]?](./messageformat.literal._cst_.md) |  | CST.Literal | **_(BETA)_** _(Optional)_ |
|  [type](./messageformat.literal.type.md) |  | 'literal' | **_(BETA)_** |
|  [value](./messageformat.literal.value.md) |  | string | **_(BETA)_** |
